name: insignificance
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of being small or not noticeable, and therefore not considered important: Advances in astronomy have reinforced the utter insignificance of Earth on a celestial scale.pale/fade into insignificance The traumas of my own upbringing pale/fade into insignificance (= seem very unimportant) when I hear stories about the way Peter's parents treated him. They relied on their obscurity and insignificancy for protection. See
insignificant
More examplesFewer examplesHe started to have a creeping sense of his own insignificance.The insignificance of last night's match was signalled by the absence of so many star names from the team.Toward the latter half of the century, the smaller states gradually dwindled down to utter insignificance.
